alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Morris; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:47PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Dickinson, Geary, Riley, north central Morris, western Wabaunsee, western Pottawatomie, Clay, southern Washington and southwestern Marshall Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clifton to near Wakefield to near Chapman. Movement was east at 45 mph. Other strong storms may also form ahead of the line and may produce small hail and 50 MPH wind gusts. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Junction City, Wamego, Clay Center, Blue Rapids, Alma, Westmoreland, Blaine, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Chapman, Wakefield, Riley, Enterprise, Waterville, St. George, Clifton, Milford, Leonardville and Alta Vista. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 277 and 331. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Morris; Pottawatomie; Riley; Wabaunsee; Washington
